deploymentMode - Deployment mode
string. Required. Allowed values: Incremental, Complete, Validation (Validation only). Default value: Incremental.

The Incremental mode handles deployments as incremental updates to the resource group. It leaves unchanged resources that exist in the resource group but are not specified in the template.

Complete mode deletes resources that are not in your template. Complete mode takes relatively more time than incremental mode. If the task times out, consider increasing the timeout or changing to the Incremental mode.

I agree the second one is incremental like everyone here but for the first one, I disagree and here is my reasoning. 

The requirement, "No other resources in a resource group named Fabrikam must be affected." implies there is an existing resource group, Fabrikam and it doesn't need to be created. Also, there is nothing in the requirements to make sure to create a resource group if it doesn't exist.

The only difference between the top two is exactly that creation part:
"Create or Update Resource Group": Creates the resource group if it doesn't already exist.
"Select Resource Group": Assumes the resource group already exists and will fail if it doesn't.

That's the only difference! And since it already exists based on the requirement, I think the appropriate choice is "Select Resource Group".
